verses.verse: My son, <S%H1121><s%> attend <S%H7181><s%> to my wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> and bow <S%H5186><s%> your ear <S%H241><s%> to my understanding: <S%H8394><s%>
That you may regard <S%H8104><s%> discretion, <S%H4209><s%> and that your lips <S%H8193><s%> may keep <S%H5341><s%> knowledge. <S%H1847><s%>
For the lips <S%H8193><s%> of a strange <S%H2114><s%> woman drop <S%H5197><s%> as an honeycomb, <S%H5317><s%> and her mouth <S%H2441><s%> is smoother <S%H2513><s%> than oil: <S%H8081><s%>
But her end <S%H319><s%> is bitter <S%H4751><s%> as wormwood, <S%H3939><s%> sharp <S%H2299><s%> as a two-edged <S%H6310><s%> sword. <S%H2719><s%>
Her feet <S%H7272><s%> go <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to death; <S%H4194><s%> her steps <S%H6806><s%> take <S%H8551><s%> hold <S%H8551><s%> on hell. <S%H7585><s%>
Lest <S%H6435><s%> you should ponder <S%H6424><s%> the path <S%H734><s%> of life, <S%H2416><s%> her ways <S%H4570><s%> are moveable, <S%H5128><s%> that you can not know <S%H3045><s%> them.
Hear <S%H8085><s%> me now <S%H6258><s%> therefore, O you children, <S%H1121><s%> and depart <S%H5493><s%> not from the words <S%H561><s%> of my mouth. <S%H6310><s%>
Remove <S%H7368><s%> your way <S%H1870><s%> far <S%H7368><s%> from her, and come <S%H7126><s%> not near <S%H7126><s%> the door <S%H6607><s%> of her house: <S%H1004><s%>
Lest <S%H6435><s%> you give <S%H5414><s%> your honor <S%H1935><s%> to others, <S%H312><s%> and your years <S%H8141><s%> to the cruel: <S%H394><s%>
Lest <S%H6435><s%> strangers <S%H2114><s%> be filled <S%H7646><s%> with your wealth; <S%H3581><s%> and your labors <S%H6089><s%> be in the house <S%H1004><s%> of a stranger; <S%H5237><s%>
And you mourn <S%H5098><s%> at the last, <S%H319><s%> when your flesh <S%H1320><s%> and your body <S%H7607><s%> are consumed, <S%H3615><s%>
And say, <S%H559><s%> How <S%H349><s%> have I hated <S%H8130><s%> instruction, <S%H4148><s%> and my heart <S%H3820><s%> despised <S%H5006><s%> reproof; <S%H8433><s%>
And have not obeyed <S%H8085><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of my teachers, <S%H3384><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> inclined <S%H5186><s%> my ear <S%H241><s%> to them that instructed <S%H3925><s%> me!
I was almost <S%H4592><s%> in all <S%H3605><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> in the middle <S%H8432><s%> of the congregation <S%H6951><s%> and assembly. <S%H5712><s%>
Drink <S%H8354><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> out of your own cistern, <S%H953><s%> and running <S%H5140><s%> waters out of your own well. <S%H875><s%>
Let your fountains <S%H4599><s%> be dispersed <S%H6327><s%> abroad, <S%H2351><s%> and rivers <S%H6388><s%> of waters <S%H4325><s%> in the streets. <S%H7339><s%>
Let them be only <S%H905><s%> your own, and not strangers' <S%H2114><s%> with you.
Let your fountain <S%H4726><s%> be blessed: <S%H1288><s%> and rejoice <S%H8055><s%> with the wife <S%H802><s%> of your youth. <S%H5271><s%>

Let her be as the loving <S%H158><s%> hind <S%H365><s%> and pleasant <S%H2580><s%> roe; <S%H3280><s%> let her breasts <S%H1717><s%> satisfy <S%H7301><s%> you at all <S%H3605><s%> times; <S%H6256><s%> and be you ravished <S%H7686><s%> always <S%H8548><s%> with her love. <S%H160><s%>
And why <S%H4100><s%> will you, my son, <S%H1121><s%> be ravished <S%H7686><s%> with a strange <S%H2114><s%> woman, and embrace <S%H2263><s%> the bosom <S%H2436><s%> of a stranger? <S%H5237><s%>
For the ways <S%H1870><s%> of man <S%H376><s%> are before <S%H5227><s%> the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and he ponders <S%H6424><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> his goings. <S%H4570><s%>
His own iniquities <S%H5771><s%> shall take <S%H3920><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> himself, and he shall be held <S%H8551><s%> with the cords <S%H2256><s%> of his sins. <S%H2403><s%>
He shall die <S%H4191><s%> without <S%H369><s%> instruction; <S%H4148><s%> and in the greatness <S%H7230><s%> of his folly <S%H200><s%> he shall go <S%H7686><s%> astray. <S%H7686><s%>
